intro: Barlia longibracteata var. gallica, commonly known as the Gallic barlia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges. It is native to Europe and parts of western Asia, where it thrives in temperate climates. Due to its delicate appearance and historical use in herbal medicine, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
